title: How much work is done to move object

content.question: Suppose the motor breaks and a person must push an object of mass <math alttext="30 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> from the bottom of the incline to the top of the incline. The person can exert a force of <math alttext="150 newtons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>150</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on the object parallel to the incline. What is the approximate amount of work that the person does on the object to move it to the top of the incline? Assume that all frictional forces are negligible.

choices.label: <math alttext="239 joules" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1050</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>J</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
<math alttext="1050 joules" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>239</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>J</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

content.answer: <math alttext="239 joules" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1050</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"> </mspace> <mtext>J</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
